statements.statement: I need to get out of my home and be active in the natural world.
Being outdoors can be just cold, wet and uncomfortable.
Working in green spaces gives me a sense of independence.
Green spaces are important to me as places to meet and talk to other people.
Simple connections with nature can give me a buzz, be it a robin at the door or watching a butterfly.
Volunteering in community activities with nature provides me with an opportunity to make a difference.
Uneven ground in green spaces and by trees in streets make it difficult for me to get around.
I sometimes worry about crime in green spaces, and this can put me off using them.
Trees have a history and connect me to my past and to the people who will come after me.
Green places evoke memories of people, events and adventures that have shaped who I am.
Regular exercise or walks in green spaces make me healthier.
I often need to feel the fresh air or feel the weather - sunshine and wind.
Green spaces offer rare moments of tranquillity and help erase the stress of modern life.
I prefer the bustle of the city: being in nature can make me feel lonely.
Green spaces are places to learn and share knowledge of nature.
